sense.name: provide with a constitution
sense.examples: The United States were constitutionalized in the late 18th century. We are there to constitutionalize Iraq rather than democratize Iraq.

sense.name: take a digestion-aiding walk after a meal
sense.commentary: Notes: Few examples found. Syntax includes: NP1[agent[animate]] CONSTITUTIONALIZE
sense.examples: A good way of exercising is to constitutionalize. *My grandfather constitutionalizes every day after dinner.

sense.name: incorporate into a constitution, make constitutional
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent[animate|organization]] CONSTITUTIONALIZE NP2[theme] (PP[location]) NP1[location] CONSTITUTIONALIZE NP2[theme]
sense.examples: This amendment would constitutionalize the cloning of embryos for destruction in research. If you constitutionalize the budgeting process, the courts will be making decisions about budgets. If the people explicitly constitutionalize discrimination, such discrimination is legal. Human rights as juridical statuses must be constitutionalized in the international system. The innovation was constitutionalized in an amendment of 1983.
